questions.text: Which car, introduced in 1964, created the 'Pony Car' class?
questions.explanation: The Ford Mustang debuted at the NY World's Fair in April 1964.
Pontiac borrowed the term from Ferrari, meaning 'Grand Touring Homologated'.

questions.text: Which engine is famously associated with Mopar muscle cars?
The Chevrolet Camaro was introduced in which year to rival the Mustang?
questions.explanation: The 1967 Camaro was Chevy's answer to the Mustang.

questions.text: What was the high-performance package for the Oldsmobile Cutlass?
questions.explanation: 4-4-2 originally stood for 4-barrel carburetor, 4-speed transmission, and dual exhaust.

questions.text: Which car featured a 'shaker' hood scoop?
questions.explanation: Shaker hoods (attached to the engine, shaking with it) were popular options on many muscle cars.

questions.text: The Dodge Charger 'General Lee' from Dukes of Hazzard was what year?
Which car had a cartoon bird on its side and a 'Beep Beep' horn?
questions.explanation: Plymouth paid Warner Bros $50,000 to use the Road Runner name and likeness.

questions.text: The Shelby Cobra featured a lightweight British body with an engine from:
questions.explanation: Carroll Shelby put Ford V8s into AC Ace bodies.

questions.text: What killed the muscle car era around 1973-1974?

options.B: The Oil Crisis and Insurance costs

questions.explanation: Rising gas prices, stricter emissions, and soaring insurance premiums ended the golden age.

questions.text: Which manufacturer produced the AMX and Javelin?
questions.explanation: AMC was the underdog fourth major automaker.

questions.text: The 'Judge' was a high-performance version of which car?
questions.explanation: "Here Come de Judge" - The GTO Judge debuted in 1969.

questions.text: The Ford Mustang Boss 429 was built to homologate its engine for:
questions.explanation: Ford needed to produce enough street cars with the Boss 429 engine to race it in NASCAR.

questions.text: Which Chevy engine code represented the ultimate big block performance?
questions.explanation: The LS6 454 in the 1970 Chevelle SS is legendary. (Though ZL1 was an exotic all-aluminum race engine, LS6 was the street king).

questions.text: Steve McQueen drove a Highland Green 1968 Mustang GT in which movie?
questions.explanation: The chase scene in 'Bullitt' is arguably the most famous in cinema history.
